result.execSummary:
The defendant Sally A Fisher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with the co-defendant or the victim listed in the criminal complaint. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be completed as a condition of probation as directed by agent.

Notice of Court Ordered Financial Obligations Status

  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Sally A Fisher in court with Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Konrad Paczuski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Williams Buttery makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

6 MONTHS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____No contact with: Co-Defendant or victim listed in criminal complaint
____50 Hours of Community Service
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent 

COSTS:  $253.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on July 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Sally A Fisher in court with Attorney Patricia Padurean.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Padurean requests a jury status and jury trial date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sally A Fisher in court with Attorney Adam Schleis for Attorney Tedia K. Gamino.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Christine Bohn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schleis requests an adjournment.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Sally A Fisher in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
